Stephanie T. Wang

I'm a third year PhD student at the University of Pennsylvania in the Computer and Information Science department. I am grateful to be advised by Professor Danaé Metaxa as a member of Penn HCI.


I design controlled experiments to understand how AI systems shape users’ behavior and exposure to information in digital media ecosystems. I also build systems that empower individuals to exert greater control over their online experiences in the face of algorithmic personalization. My aim is to inform the design of socially beneficial AI technologies that empower individuals, support democratic participation, and mitigate inequalities in power.


Before starting my PhD, I worked as a software engineer in the tech industry, first at Sisu Data, then at Apple. I earned both my MS in Computer Science and my BS in Symbolic Systems from Stanford University. My work has been generously supported by an AWS gift for research in Trustworthy AI.

NEWS

04/2025

Attending CHI News Futures Workshop in Yokohama, Japan to present work on our user-centered approach to understanding what’s political on TikTok.

11/2024

I will be attending CSCW in San Jose, Costa Rica to present our work, “Lower Quantity, Higher Quality Auditing News Content and User Perceptions on Twitter/X Algorithmic versus Chronological Timelines”.

08/2024

My paper with Shengchun Huang won First Place Faculty Paper, Political Communication Division at Association for Education in Journalism and Mass Communication (AEJMC)!

07/2024

I went to IC2S2 at the Univeristy of Pennsylvania to present work on auditing social media news feeds.
